intro: Streptanthus crassifolius, commonly known as the thick-leaved whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Streptanthus crassifolius is often found in California and Oregon, where it thrives in full sun.
